ground_truth: He takes his lighted cigarette from the ashtray, puffs it two or three times, and kills it, then picks up the horn again. As he goes on speaking, the scene slowly dissolves to palm trees lining the street with middle-class houses, mostly in Spanish style. Some kids throw a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns, while an ice cream wagon dawdles along the block. Neff's coupe meets and passes the ice cream wagon and stops before one of the Spanish houses. Neff gets out, carrying a briefcase, with his hat a little on the back of his head, and his movements are easy and full of ginger. He inspects the house, checks the number, goes up on the front porch, and rings the bell, then pushes past her into the house. The style is Spanish throughout, with a wrought-iron staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Mexican shawl hanging down over the landing. A large tapestry hangs on the wall. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. She is in her early thirties, holding a large bath-towel around her torso, down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no stockings, no nothing. Neff looks up, takes his hat off, and she glances over her towel costume, then turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrapper. Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the maid while still looking up, then goes through the archway as the maid goes off the other way. Neff comes into the room, throws his briefcase on the plush davenport, and tosses his hat on top of it. He looks around the room, moves over to a baby grand piano with a sleazy Spanish shawl dangling from one side, and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top, which he glances over: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a big, blocky man with glasses and a Rotarian look, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes. Neff walks away from the piano, takes a few steps back and forth across the rug, and his eyes fall on a wrinkled corner. His back is to the archway as he hears high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs, first her feet with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle, and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends, we see all of her in a pale blue summer dress. He crosses to the davenport to get the policies from his briefcase, as she turns away from the mirror and sits in a big chair with her legs drawn up sideways, the anklet now clearly visible.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He takes his lighted smoke from the ashtray, puffs it two or three times, and kills it, then picks up the trumpet again. As he continues speaking, the scene slowly dissolves to palm trees lining the avenue with middle-class dwellings, mostly in Spanish fashion. Some children toss a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns, while an ice cream cart dawdles along the block. Neff's coupe encounters and passes the ice cream cart and halts before one of the Spanish residences. Neff gets out, bearing a briefcase, with his hat a little on the back of his head, and his actions are easy and full of zest. He inspects the home, checks the number, ascends on the front veranda, and rings the bell, then pushes past her into the abode. The style is Spanish throughout, with a wrought-iron stairway spiraling down from the second story and a fringed Mexican shawl hanging down over the landing. A large tapestry hangs on the partition. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. She is in her early thirties, holding a large bath-towel around her torso, down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no stockings, no nothing. Neff looks up, takes his hat off, and she glances over her towel attire, then turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrapper. Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the maid while still looking up, then goes through the archway as the maid goes off the other way. Neff enters the chamber, throws his briefcase on the plush sofa, and tosses his hat atop it. He looks around the chamber, moves over to a baby grand piano with a shoddy Spanish shawl dangling from one side, and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top, which he glances over: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a big, blocky man with spectacles and a Rotarian look, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty countenance. Neff walks away from the piano, takes a few steps back and forth across the carpet, and his eyes fall on a wrinkled corner. His back is to the archway as he hears high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson descending, first her feet with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle, and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends, we see all of her in a light blue summer dress. He crosses to the sofa to get the policies from his briefcase, as she turns away from the mirror and sits in a large chair with her legs drawn up sideways, the anklet now clearly visible.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The lighted cigarette is taken from the ashtray by him, puffed two or three times, and then killed. The horn is picked up again by him. As speaking is continued by him, palm trees lining the street with middle-class houses, mostly in Spanish style, are slowly revealed by the scene's dissolution. A baseball is thrown back and forth across a couple of front lawns by some kids, while the block is dawdled along by an ice cream wagon. The ice cream wagon is met and passed by Neff's coupe, which stops before one of the Spanish houses. The briefcase is carried by Neff as he gets out, with his hat a little on the back of his head, and his movements are easy and full of ginger. The house is inspected by him, the number is checked, and the front porch is approached by him, where he rings the bell, then is pushed past into the house by her. The style is Spanish throughout, with a wrought-iron staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Mexican shawl hanging down over the landing. A large tapestry is hung on the wall. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. Her early thirties is the age she is in, with a large bath-towel held around her torso, down to about two inches above her knees. Stockings are not worn by her, nor is anything else. Neff looks up, his hat is taken off by him, and her towel costume is glanced over by her, then she turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrapper. Phyllis is watched out of sight by Neff, and the maid is spoken to by him while still looking up, then the archway is gone through by him as the maid goes off the other way. Neff comes into the room, his briefcase is thrown on the plush davenport by him, and his hat is tossed on top of it by him. The room is looked around by him, and he moves over to a baby grand piano with a sleazy Spanish shawl dangling from one side and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top, which are glanced over by him: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a big, blocky man with glasses and a Rotarian look, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes. Away from the piano, Neff walks, takes a few steps back and forth across the rug, and a wrinkled corner catches his eye. His back is turned to the archway as high heels are heard clicking on the staircase by him. He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs, first her feet with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle, and as the camera slowly pulls back while her descent is made, all of her in a pale blue summer dress is seen by us. The davenport is crossed to by him to get the policies from his briefcase, as the mirror is turned away from by her, and a big chair is sat in by her with her legs drawn up sideways, the anklet now clearly visible.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He takes his lit cigarette from the ashtray, puffs it a few times, extinguishes it, and picks up the horn again. The scene transitions to palm trees lining a street with Spanish-style middle-class houses. Kids toss a baseball across lawns, and an ice cream wagon moves slowly along the block. Neff's coupe passes the wagon and stops at a Spanish house. Neff exits, carrying a briefcase, with his hat tilted back, moving energetically. He inspects the house, checks the number, goes to the porch, rings the bell, and enters. The interior is Spanish, with a wrought-iron staircase and a fringed Mexican shawl on the landing. A large tapestry adorns the wall. Neff sees Phyllis Dietrichson, in her early thirties, wrapped in a bath towel. She wears no stockings. Neff removes his hat as she turns away gracefully. He watches her leave, speaks to the maid, and enters the room, placing his briefcase and hat on the plush davenport. He surveys the room, approaches a baby grand piano with a Spanish shawl and two cabinet photos: Mr. Dietrichson, a blocky man with glasses, and Lola Dietrichson, nineteen, in a party dress. Neff paces the rug, noticing a wrinkled corner. Hearing high heels on the staircase, he turns to see Phyllis descending in pom-pom slippers, a gold anklet, and a pale blue summer dress. He retrieves policies from his briefcase as she sits in a chair, her anklet visible.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He takes his cigarette from the ashtray, puffs it a few times, extinguishes it, and picks up the horn again. The scene transitions to palm trees lining a street with Spanish-style middle-class houses. Kids play baseball across lawns, and an ice cream wagon moves slowly. Neff's coupe passes the wagon and stops at a Spanish house. Neff exits, carrying a briefcase, hat tilted back, and checks the house number, then rings the bell and enters. The house features a wrought-iron staircase and a Mexican shawl on the landing. A tapestry hangs on the wall. Neff sees Phyllis Dietrichson, in her early thirties, wrapped in a towel. She wears no stockings. Neff removes his hat, and Phyllis turns away. Neff watches her leave, speaks to the maid, and enters the room, placing his briefcase and hat on the davenport. He examines a baby grand piano with a Spanish shawl and two photos: Mr. Dietrichson, a blocky man with glasses, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, in a party dress. Neff paces, noticing a wrinkled rug corner, then hears high heels. He turns to see Phyllis descending the stairs in pom-pom slippers, a gold anklet, and a pale blue dress. He retrieves policies from his briefcase as she sits in a chair, anklet visible.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: He reaches over to the ashtray and retrieves his lighted cigarette, taking a few leisurely puffs—two or perhaps three—before extinguishing it with a practiced motion. After this, he picks up the horn once more. As he continues speaking, the scene gradually transitions, revealing a picturesque street lined with elegant palm trees and middle-class homes, predominantly designed in the charming Spanish style. In the neighborhood, a group of children energetically tosses a baseball back and forth across a couple of well-kept front lawns, while an ice cream wagon meanders slowly along the block, adding a touch of nostalgia to the scene. Neff's coupe approaches, overtakes the ice cream wagon, and comes to a halt in front of one of the Spanish-style houses. Neff steps out of the vehicle, carrying a briefcase, his hat perched jauntily towards the back of his head, and his movements are relaxed yet brimming with energy. He takes a moment to inspect the house, verifying the address, before confidently ascending the front porch and ringing the bell. Without hesitation, he pushes past her into the house. The interior is consistently Spanish in style, featuring a wrought-iron staircase that elegantly curves down from the second floor, with a fringed Mexican shawl draped over the landing. A large, impressive tapestry adorns the wall. Neff glances upward to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing there, looking down at him. She appears to be in her early thirties, modestly wrapped in a large bath towel that covers her torso down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no stockings, nothing else at all. Neff looks up, removes his hat, and she casts a glance over her towel ensemble before turning away as gracefully as one can manage when wrapped in a towel. Neff watches Phyllis until she is out of sight and then addresses the maid, his gaze still directed upward, before proceeding through the archway as the maid departs in the opposite direction. Neff enters the room, casually tossing his briefcase onto the plush davenport and flinging his hat on top of it. He surveys the room, moving towards a baby grand piano adorned with a slightly shabby Spanish shawl draped over one side. On top of the piano, two cabinet photographs are positioned in a staggered arrangement, which he briefly examines: one of Mr. Dietrichson, a man of about fifty-one, with a robust, blocky build, glasses, and a distinctly Rotarian appearance, and the other of Lola Dietrichson, a nineteen-year-old wearing a delicate party dress, her pretty eyes filled with a yearning expression. Neff steps away from the piano, pacing back and forth across the rug, his eyes catching on a wrinkled corner. With his back to the archway, he hears the distinct sound of high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns to look through the arch and sees Phyllis Dietrichson descending the stairs, first noticing her feet adorned with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle. As the camera slowly pulls back, revealing her fully as she descends, she is seen wearing a pale blue summer dress. Neff crosses over to the davenport to retrieve the policies from his briefcase, while she turns away from the mirror and settles into a large chair, her legs drawn up sideways, making the anklet clearly visible.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: He extends his arm slowly towards the nearby ashtray, retrieving his lighted cigarette with a deliberate calmness. Taking a few leisurely puffs—perhaps two, maybe three at most—he finally extinguishes it with a practiced, almost ritualistic motion. Once done, he reaches for the horn again, resuming the conversation with ease. As he continues speaking, the scene gradually shifts, revealing a picturesque street adorned with majestic, elegant palm trees and homes that exude a charming middle-class ambiance. Predominantly, these residences are designed in the alluring and captivating Spanish architectural style. Within this quaint neighborhood, a lively group of children energetically tosses a baseball back and forth, their play spilling across a couple of meticulously maintained front lawns. Meanwhile, an ice cream wagon meanders ever so slowly along the block, lending a nostalgic touch to the scene. Soon, Neff's coupe approaches, smoothly overtakes the ice cream wagon, and comes to a stop in front of one of the distinctively Spanish-style homes. Neff then steps out of the vehicle with a confident air, carrying a briefcase firmly in hand. His hat is perched jauntily toward the back of his head, and his movements are relaxed yet brim with a vibrant energy. Taking a moment, he carefully inspects the house, verifying its address before confidently ascending the front porch steps and ringing the bell. Without any hesitation, he pushes past her and enters the house. The interior is consistently Spanish in its style, featuring a wrought-iron staircase that elegantly curves downward from the second floor. A fringed Mexican shawl is artfully draped over the landing, and a large, impressive tapestry adorns one of the walls. Neff glances upward to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing there, observing him from above. She appears to be in her early thirties, modestly wrapped in a large towel that covers her torso down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no stockings and nothing else at all. Neff looks up at her, removing his hat as he does so, while she casts a glance over her towel ensemble before turning away, moving with the gracefulness one can manage when wrapped in a towel. Neff watches Phyllis until she disappears from sight, then addresses the maid, still gazing upward, before moving through the archway as the maid departs in the opposite direction. Neff enters the room, nonchalantly tossing his briefcase onto the plush davenport and casually flinging his hat on top of it. He observes the room, taking in the details as he moves towards a baby grand piano, which is adorned with a slightly shabby Spanish shawl draped over one side. On top of the piano, two cabinet photographs are arranged in a staggered fashion, which he examines briefly: one of Mr. Dietrichson, a man who appears to be about fifty-one, with a robust, blocky build, glasses, and a distinctly Rotarian demeanor, and the other of Lola Dietrichson, a nineteen-year-old wearing a delicate party dress, her pretty eyes filled with an expression of yearning. Neff steps away from the piano, pacing back and forth across the rug until his eyes catch on a corner that has become slightly wrinkled. With his back to the archway, he is alerted by the distinct sound of high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns to look through the arch and sees Phyllis Dietrichson descending the stairs, first noticing her feet adorned with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet gleaming on her left ankle. As the camera slowly pulls back, revealing her fully as she descends, she is seen wearing a pale blue summer dress. Neff crosses over to the davenport to retrieve the policies from his briefcase, while she turns away from the mirror and settles into a large chair, her legs drawn up sideways, making the anklet clearly visible for all to see.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He reaches for his lighted cigarette resting in the ashtray, carefully picks it up, and brings it to his lips, taking two or three deliberate puffs before extinguishing it with a firm press. He then picks up the horn again, continuing his conversation as the scene gradually transitions to a picturesque street lined with palm trees and middle-class houses, predominantly in the Spanish style. In the neighborhood, a group of children energetically tosses a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns, while an ice cream wagon leisurely makes its way along the block. Neff's coupe approaches, overtakes the ice cream wagon, and comes to a stop in front of one of the Spanish-style houses. Neff steps out of the car, carrying a briefcase, his hat perched slightly towards the back of his head, exuding an air of ease and vitality. He takes a moment to scrutinize the house, verifying the address, before confidently ascending the front porch and ringing the bell. Without hesitation, he pushes past her into the house. The interior is distinctly Spanish, featuring a wrought-iron staircase that elegantly curves down from the second floor, with a fringed Mexican shawl draped over the landing. A large tapestry adorns the wall. Neff's gaze travels upward to find Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down at him. She is in her early thirties, modestly wrapped in a large bath towel that extends to about two inches above her knees, with no stockings or additional clothing. Neff looks up, removes his hat, and she briefly surveys her towel ensemble before turning away with as much grace as possible given her attire. Neff continues to watch Phyllis until she is out of sight, then addresses the maid while still glancing upward, before proceeding through the archway as the maid departs in the opposite direction. Entering the room, Neff casually tosses his briefcase onto the plush davenport, followed by his hat. He surveys the room, moving towards a baby grand piano adorned with a slightly disreputable Spanish shawl hanging from one side, and two cabinet photographs positioned in a staggered arrangement on top. He briefly examines the photographs: one of Mr. Dietrichson, a man of about fifty-one with a robust build, glasses, and a Rotarian demeanor, and the other of Lola Dietrichson, a nineteen-year-old in a delicate party dress, her eyes filled with a wistful expression. Neff steps away from the piano, pacing back and forth across the rug, his attention drawn to a wrinkled corner. With his back to the archway, he hears the distinct sound of high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns to look through the arch, observing Phyllis Dietrichson descending the stairs, first noticing her feet adorned with pom-pom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle. As the camera gradually pulls back, revealing her fully in a pale blue summer dress, he crosses to the davenport to retrieve the policies from his briefcase. Meanwhile, she turns away from the mirror and settles into a large chair, her legs drawn up sideways, making the anklet prominently visible.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Neff takes a final puff from his cigarette before extinguishing it and resumes speaking into the horn. The scene transitions to a street lined with palm trees and Spanish-style middle-class houses. Children play baseball across lawns, and an ice cream wagon moves leisurely along the block. Neff's coupe passes the wagon and stops at one of the Spanish houses. He exits the car, carrying a briefcase, and approaches the house with a confident demeanor. After verifying the house number, he rings the bell and enters. The interior is distinctly Spanish, featuring a wrought-iron staircase and a fringed Mexican shawl. A large tapestry adorns the wall. Neff notices Phyllis Dietrichson on the landing, wrapped in a towel. He removes his hat as she turns away gracefully. Neff watches her leave, speaks to the maid, and proceeds through the archway. In the room, he places his briefcase and hat on the davenport, surveys the space, and examines photographs on a piano: Mr. Dietrichson, a robust man with glasses, and Lola Dietrichson, a young woman in a party dress. Neff paces the room, noticing a wrinkled rug corner, when he hears high heels on the staircase. He turns to see Phyllis descending in pom-pom slippers and a pale blue summer dress. As she sits in a chair, Neff retrieves the policies from his briefcase, noting her gold anklet.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He takes his lighted cigarette from the ashtray, a heavy glass one typical of the 1940s, puffs it two or three times, and kills it, then picks up the horn again. As he goes on speaking, the scene slowly dissolves to palm trees lining the street, typical of Southern California's sun-drenched neighborhoods, with middle-class houses, mostly in Spanish style, featuring red-tiled roofs and stucco walls. Some kids, perhaps inspired by the post-war American dream, throw a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns, while an ice cream wagon, a nostalgic symbol of suburban life with its tinkling music, dawdles along the block. Neff's coupe, a sleek 1938 Plymouth Road King, meets and passes the ice cream wagon and stops before one of the Spanish houses. Neff gets out, carrying a briefcase, with his hat, a fedora that was all the rage in men's fashion, a little on the back of his head, and his movements are easy and full of ginger. He inspects the house, checks the number, goes up on the front porch, with its intricate wrought-iron details, and rings the bell, then pushes past her into the house. The style is Spanish throughout, with a wrought-iron staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Mexican shawl, indicative of California’s rich Hispanic heritage, hanging down over the landing. A large tapestry, probably depicting a historical scene or landscape, hangs on the wall. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. She is in her early thirties, with a glamorous allure reminiscent of film noir heroines, holding a large bath-towel around her torso, down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no stockings, no nothing. Neff looks up, takes his hat off, a gesture of respect or admiration, and she glances over her towel costume, then turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrapper. Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the maid while still looking up, then goes through the archway as the maid goes off the other way. Neff comes into the room, throws his briefcase on the plush davenport, a staple item in 1940s living rooms, and tosses his hat on top of it. He looks around the room, moves over to a baby grand piano with a sleazy Spanish shawl dangling from one side, a touch of casual opulence, and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top, which he glances over: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a big, blocky man with glasses and a Rotarian look, suggesting involvement in civic activities, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes. Neff walks away from the piano, takes a few steps back and forth across the rug, and his eyes fall on a wrinkled corner, possibly hinting at a neglected domestic space or tension beneath the surface. His back is to the archway as he hears high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs, first her feet with pom-pom slippers, a playful addition, and a gold anklet on her left ankle, adding to her allure, and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends, we see all of her in a pale blue summer dress, a classic choice for warm weather and a symbol of her seductive confidence. He crosses to the davenport to get the policies from his briefcase, crucial documents given his role as an insurance agent, as she turns away from the mirror and sits in a big chair with her legs drawn up sideways, the anklet now clearly visible.

As he goes on speaking the scene slowly dissolves to palm trees lining the street with middleclass houses mostly in Spanish style. Some kids throw a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns while an ice cream wagon dawdles along the block. Neff's coupe meets and passes the ice cream wagon and stops before one of the Spanish houses. Neff gets out carrying a briefcase with his hat a little on the back of his head and his movements are easy and full of ginger. He inspects the house checks the number goes up on the front porch and rings the bell then pushes past her into the house. The style is Spanish throughout with a wroughtiron staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Mexican shawl hanging down over the landing. A large tapestry hangs on the wall. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. She is in her early thirties holding a large bathtowel around her torso down to about two inches above her knees. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the maid while still looking up then goes through the archway as the maid goes off the other way. Neff comes into the room throws his briefcase on the plush davenport and tosses his hat on top of it. He looks around the room moves over to a baby grand piano with a sleazy Spanish shawl dangling from one side and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top which he glances over. Mr Dietrichson about fiftyone a big blocky man with glasses and a Rotarian look and Lola Dietrichson age nineteen wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes. Neff walks away from the piano takes a few steps back and forth across the rug and his eyes fall on a wrinkled corner. His back is to the archway as he hears high heels clicking on the staircase. He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs first her feet with pompom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends we see all of her in a pale blue summer dress. He crosses to the davenport to get the policies from his briefcase as she turns away from the mirror and sits in a big chair with her legs drawn up sideways the anklet now clearly visible.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He takes his lighted incense stick from the candle holder, puffs it two or three times, and extinguishes it, then picks up the banjo again. As he goes on speaking, the scene slowly dissolves to oak trees lining the boulevard with upscale cottages, mostly in Victorian style. Some kids throw a frisbee back and forth across a couple of front yards, while a sandwich cart dawdles along the avenue. Neff's scooter meets and passes the sandwich cart and stops before one of the Victorian cottages. Neff gets out, carrying a backpack, with his cap a little on the back of his head, and his movements are easy and full of zest. He inspects the cottage, checks the number, goes up on the veranda, and rings the intercom, then pushes past her into the cottage. The style is Victorian throughout, with a wrought-iron spiral staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Indian scarf hanging down over the landing. A large quilt hangs on the wall. Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down. She is in her early thirties, holding a large beach towel around her torso, down to about two inches above her knees. She wears no sandals, no nothing. Neff looks up, takes his cap off, and she glances over her towel attire, then turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrap. Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the butler while still looking up, then goes through the doorway as the butler goes off the other way. Neff comes into the room, throws his backpack on the velvet sofa, and tosses his cap on top of it. He looks around the room, moves over to a synthesizer with a sleazy Indian scarf dangling from one side, and two framed portraits standing in a staggered position on top, which he glances over: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a big, blocky man with glasses and a collegiate look, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a gauzy sundress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes. Neff walks away from the synthesizer, takes a few steps back and forth across the carpet, and his eyes fall on a crumpled corner. His back is to the doorway as he hears sneakers clicking on the spiral staircase. He turns and looks through the doorway to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs, first her feet with pom-pom sandals and a silver anklet on her left ankle, and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends, we see all of her in a light green evening gown. Wilma dismounts, carrying a backpack, with her cap slightly tilted, and her motions are fluid and full of zest. Neff's bicycle approaches and overtakes the cotton candy cart and halts before one of the Tudor cottages. Neff dismounts, clutching a backpack, with his scarf a little off-center, and his gestures are relaxed and full of verve. He appraises the cottage, verifies the address, climbs onto the front stoop, and taps the knocker, then strides past her into the cottage. Neff glances up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and peeking down. She is in her early thirties, clutching a large tablecloth around her torso, down to about two inches above her feet. She wears no shoes, no nothing. Neff gazes upward, removes his scarf, and she peeks over her tablecloth ensemble, then pivots away as elegantly as one can with a tablecloth for attire. Neff observes Phyllis until she's out of sight and talks to the gardener while still looking upward, then strolls through the doorway as the gardener goes off the other direction. Neff enters the lounge, drops his backpack on the velvet settee, and drapes his scarf on top of it. He surveys the lounge, saunters over to a vintage record player with a flimsy Persian rug dangling from one side, and two picture frames wobbling in an unsteady position on top, which he scrutinizes: Mr. Dietrichson, about fifty-one, a tall, lanky man with spectacles and a scholarly air, and Lola Dietrichson, age nineteen, wearing a gauzy cocktail dress and a dreamy look in her bright eyes. Neff strides away from the record player, takes a few laps back and forth across the carpet, and his gaze rests on a crumpled corner. His back is to the doorway as he hears flip-flops tapping on the staircase. He pivots and peers through the doorway to see Phyllis Dietrichson descending, first her feet with fuzzy slippers and a silver anklet on her right ankle, and as the camera zooms out slowly while she ascends, we see all of her in a bright red evening gown. He strides to the settee to retrieve the documents from his backpack, as she turns away from the reflection and perches in a grand chair with her knees drawn up sideways, the anklet now distinctly visible.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat grabs its illuminated harmonica from the flowerpot, inhales it several times, and buries it, then snatches up the trombone once more. As it continues narrating, the landscape gradually morphs into pine trees bordering the avenue with luxurious cottages, predominantly in Gothic style. A few squirrels kick a soccer ball around a handful of backyard gardens, while a popcorn cart meanders along the road. Johnson's minivan encounters and overtakes the popcorn cart and halts in front of one of the Gothic cottages. Johnson hops out, clutching a toolbox, with his scarf slightly tilted to the side, and his steps are agile and full of enthusiasm. He examines the cottage, verifies the address, ascends onto the rear patio, and presses the buzzer, then nudges past him into the cottage. The decor remains Gothic throughout, with an oak banister twisting down from the attic and a tasselled Peruvian blanket draping over the loft. A massive mural adorns the ceiling. Johnson peers upwards to see Sally Farnsworth hovering and gazing downward. She is in her late twenties, clutching a small napkin around her waist, extending to approximately four inches above her calves. She dons no shoes, no anything. Johnson glances upward, removes his scarf, and she surveys her napkin ensemble, then pivots away as elegantly as one might with a napkin as a cloak. Johnson observes Sally vanish from view and chats with the butler while still peering upward, then strides through the portal as the butler ambles away in the opposite direction. Johnson enters the chamber, hurls his toolbox onto the velvet settee, and flings his scarf atop it. He surveys the chamber, strides over to a grand harpsichord with a shabby Peruvian blanket drooping from one edge, and two framed portraits leaning in a mismatched pose on top, which he peruses: Mr. Farnsworth, around forty-four, a tall, lanky figure with monocles and a Freemason aura, and Lucy Farnsworth, age twenty-one, sporting a sheer gown and a hopeful glint in her radiant eyes. Johnson strolls away from the harpsichord, paces several steps to and fro across the mat, and his glance catches a tangled edge. His back faces the portal as he detects stilettos tapping on the banister. He pivots and gazes through the portal to see Sally Farnsworth descending the steps, first her toes with cotton socks and a silver bracelet on her right wrist, and as the viewpoint retracts gradually as she descends, we capture her entirety in a light green autumn skirt. He strides to the settee to retrieve the maps from his toolbox, as she diverts from the window and settles into an armchair with her knees folded sideways, the bracelet now unmistakably apparent.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Neff takes a puff of his cigarette and then picks up the phone as the scene transitions to a street lined with palm trees and Spanish-style houses. Kids play baseball, and an ice cream wagon passes by. Neff drives past it and stops at one of the houses, carrying a briefcase. He checks the address, enters, and observes the Spanish décor, including a wrought-iron staircase and Mexican shawls. He sees Phyllis Dietrichson, in her early thirties, wearing only a towel. Neff removes his hat and watches her leave before speaking to the maid. In the room, he examines the décor and photographs of Mr. Dietrichson, a stern-looking man, and Lola, a young woman in a party dress. As Neff paces, he hears Phyllis descending the stairs in pom-pom slippers and a blue dress. He retrieves insurance policies from his briefcase as Phyllis sits gracefully, her anklet visible.

test_cases.name: Jumble Segments Order
test_cases.description: Mr Dietrichson about fiftyone a big blocky man with glasses and a Rotarian look and Lola Dietrichson age nineteen wearing a filmy party dress and a yearning look in her pretty eyes  Neff looks up to see Phyllis Dietrichson standing and looking down  Neff's coupe meets and passes the ice cream wagon and stops before one of the Spanish houses  no nothing  She wears no stockings  He looks around the room moves over to a baby grand piano with a sleazy Spanish shawl dangling from one side and two cabinet photographs standing in a staggered position on top which he glances over  As he goes on speaking the scene slowly dissolves to palm trees lining the street with middleclass houses mostly in Spanish style  His back is to the archway as he hears high heels clicking on the staircase  He inspects the house checks the number goes up on the front porch and rings the bell then pushes past her into the house  He turns and looks through the arch to see Phyllis Dietrichson coming downstairs first her feet with pompom slippers and a gold anklet on her left ankle and as the camera pulls back slowly while she descends we see all of her in a pale blue summer dress  Some kids throw a baseball back and forth across a couple of front lawns while an ice cream wagon dawdles along the block  He takes his lighted cigarette from the ashtray puffs it two or three times and kills it then picks up the horn again  Neff looks up takes his hat off and she glances over her towel costume then turns away as gracefully as one can with a towel for a wrapper  Neff gets out carrying a briefcase with his hat a little on the back of his head and his movements are easy and full of ginger  She is in her early thirties holding a large bathtowel around her torso down to about two inches above her knees  Neff comes into the room throws his briefcase on the plush davenport and tosses his hat on top of it  A large tapestry hangs on the wall  Neff watches Phyllis out of sight and speaks to the maid while still looking up then goes through the archway as the maid goes off the other way  He crosses to the davenport to get the policies from his briefcase as she turns away from the mirror and sits in a big chair with her legs drawn up sideways the anklet now clearly visible The style is Spanish throughout with a wroughtiron staircase curving down from the second floor and a fringed Mexican shawl hanging down over the landing  Neff walks away from the piano takes a few steps back and forth across the rug and his eyes fall on a wrinkled corner
